metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1002200 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: plexus-archiver before 3.6.0 is vulnerable to directory traversal, allowing attackers to write to arbitrary files via a ../ (dot dot slash) in an archive entry that is mishandled during extraction. This vulnerability is also known as 'Zip-Slip'. It was discovered that plexus-archiver incorectly handled directory traversal during extraction. An attacker could possibly use this for a Zip-Slip attack.

criterions.comment: plexus-archiver package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.0-2').
